About.title: About me
About.aboutText: Hello! My name is <rainbow>Kauã Villa Nova</rainbow> and I am a graduate student in <highlight>Information Systems</highlight> with experience in full-stack development, focused on creating efficient and innovative solutions. Passionate about technology, I am always looking for new challenges that allow me to grow professionally and contribute to impactful projects!<break></break>I have a special fondness for <highlight>mobile</highlight> and <highlight>front-end web</highlight> development, creating (from scratch, if necessary) interactive, user-friendly, and high-performance applications.

descriptions.neonnest: NeonNest is an e-commerce that predicts a cyberpunk reality and allows you to be prepared for it when it happens. It has unique styles and products, as well as allowing the user to do most of the actions that would be done in a real e-commerce. I recommend you take a look at its GitHub page to get a better understanding of the project.
descriptions.wegia: I've been involved in the full-stack development of the project during my internship and work period. I was responsible for part of the PET module development and changes in other modules and general website interfaces.
descriptions.spaceTourism: Space-themed page, which presents curiosities about astronomy. Most of the pages in this project are powered by a JSON file.
descriptions.multiStepForm: A 4-step form that stores and processes all entered values. It is possible to navigate the form freely and all fields will be saved automatically.
descriptions.ipTracker: The project uses two APIs, one to take the data about the IPs or domains filled and the other to form a map, which automatically receives the latitude and longitude informed and approaches the location.
descriptions.interactiveCard: During the filling of the card data, the text is changed automatically. To ensure that the fields are filled in correctly, each has its own verifications and regular expressions where necessary.
descriptions.magipass: Magipass is a mobile application that provides exclusive offers from partner businesses through the purchase of passes. I was responsible for designing and structuring the project architecture, as well as for the full development of both the mobile application and the backend, implemented as a RESTful API.<break></break>The application enables pass purchase and management, offer browsing and redemption, and user authentication, which can be performed either through external identity providers or via email and password. The system supports three distinct user roles—customers, registered business owners, and administrators—each with dedicated workflows and interfaces, ensuring an appropriate experience for every type of access.
descriptions.qrypt: QRypt was developed as an academic project focused on enhancing the security of QR Codes generated by digital applications. The project emerged in response to the growing threat of quishing, a form of phishing that uses QR Codes as an attack vector. In this practice, malicious actors place QR Codes in strategic locations to trick unsuspecting users into accessing malicious links or completing fraudulent payment actions.<break></break>QRypt aims to mitigate this problem by providing a secure environment for QR Code generation and validation, based on three core pillars: (1) mandatory user authentication for QR Code creation; (2) encryption of all generated QR Codes to ensure the integrity and validity of their content; and (3) a community-driven reporting mechanism that automatically disables a QR Code once it reaches a predefined number of reports, reducing the risk of misuse by malicious users.
